details.description: Motorhomes and campervans - size limits and licences you need to drive in the UK
details.body:
You need the right licence to drive a motorhome or campervan, and your vehicle needs to be within UK size limits.

Licence requirements

Check if you have the right licence to be able to drive your motorhome.

Size limits

If you want to import a motorhome into the UK permanently you’ll need to register it.

The size of motorhomes are restricted in the UK and you can’t register one more than 12 metres long and 2.55 metres wide, unless it has an Individual Vehicle Approval (IVA) certificate.

The measurements don’t include driving mirrors, bumpers, lamps, or reflectors.

There’s no height limit, but if the motorhome is over 3 metres tall you must have a notice showing the height where the driver can see it.
